fields.description:
See https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/UPM-4871

UserUtil.getActiveUserCount includes sysadmin and connect users in OD. This causes problems for Connect and UPM.

There are two ways we could fix this:
* add a new method to UserUtil to give a count excluding the sysadmin and connect users iff the instance is in OD mode
* edit the existing method to do that.
fields.summary: UserUtil.getActiveUserCount includes sysadmin and connect users in OD

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42388].
  {panel}

I have issue with the JIRA Issues macro:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/JIRA+Issues+Macro

I have created a macro based on a JIRA filter.

What the JIRA filter displays does not seem to be dynamic.  It appears to be fixed at whatever matched the JQL at the time the page was saved.

This is highly frustrating as I've tried to create a "What is Matthew working on page" using a JIRA Issues macro pointing to a filter that includes all the stuff he is working on ordered by Rank and then Priority.

But the order is not reflected in the Confluence page.

Also, as issues change Assignee, Status, Rank and Priority the page does not change./

I would have expected there to be at least the option of making the JIRa Issues macro dynamic
fields.summary: JIRA Issues macro does not actively update matching issues

fields.description:
I recently did an upgrade of our Jira test environment to the latest version, and when I ran through the installer, I specified a control port of 8004 since we have another Tomcat instance running on that test box.

{noformat}
muwebappstest:/home/installers # ./atlassian-jira-6.3.15-x32.bin
Unpacking JRE ...
Starting Installer ...
Mar 10, 2015 9:30:37 AM java.util.prefs.FileSystemPreferences$1 run
INFO: Created user preferences directory.

This will install JIRA 6.3.15 on your computer.
OK [o, Enter], Cancel [c]

Choose the appropriate installation or upgrade option.
Please choose one of the following:
Express Install (use default settings) [1], Custom Install (recommended for advanced users) [2, Enter], Upgrade an existing JIRA installation [3]
2

Where should JIRA 6.3.15 be installed?
[/opt/atlassian/jira]

Default location for JIRA data
[/var/atlassian/application-data/jira]

Configure which ports JIRA will use.
JIRA requires two TCP ports that are not being used by any other
applications on this machine. The HTTP port is where you will access JIRA
through your browser. The Control port is used to Startup and Shutdown JIRA.
Use default ports (HTTP: 8080, Control: 8005) - Recommended [1, Enter], Set custom value for HTTP and Control ports [2]
2
HTTP Port Number
[8080]

Control Port Number
[8005]
8004
JIRA can be run in the background.
You may choose to run JIRA as a service, which means it will start
automatically whenever the computer restarts.
Install JIRA as Service?
Yes [y, Enter], No [n]

Extracting files ...

Please wait a few moments while JIRA starts up.
Launching JIRA ...
Installation of JIRA 6.3.15 is complete
Your installation of JIRA 6.3.15 is now ready and can be accessed via your
browser.
JIRA 6.3.15 can be accessed at http://localhost:8080
Finishing installation ...
You have new mail in /var/mail/root
{noformat}

However, when I went to access the instance, it had died. Checking the Tomcat logs, I found that it had died because something else was listening on port 8005 (which I knew.) I checked the Jira server.xml file, and it was listening on  port 8005 for the control, rather than the 8004 that I'd specified during the installer. I changed this to 8004, and things worked fine after starting Jira.
fields.summary: Jira 6.3.15 Linux installer ignores custom option for control port

fields.description:
When an exception is thrown during processing of a {{GET rest/api/2/attachment/<id>}}, the returned response includes stacktrace.
It should not be included.

In contrast, exceptions thrown during a {{DELETE rest/api/2/attachment/<id>}} request properly hide the stacktrace.

The stacktrace still should be visible in logs, but its exposure is incomparably more limited.
fields.summary: GET rest/api/2/attachment/{id} yields stacktrace

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42369].
  {panel}

Currently if the resolution field is populated, the ticket # will show up with strikethrough text. There are workflow work arounds to remove this currently but they do not always apply to every customer that wants to have this option.

If customers could easily change the font variation used when a ticket shows as resolved, it would certainly improve workflow for some customers.

h3. Workaround
If you don't want it, make sure you don't set the resolution field at all. Check your work flow post functions and remove if there are any.
fields.summary: Easily allow the removal of strikethrough text for closed / resolved issues / stories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42368].
  {panel}

Need to make specific custom fields required when creating or on a transition screen based on the value of another custom field. 

For example, custom field Existing Client, Y/N
If Yes, Current Products, Pricing, and # of Licensed Users are required
If No, Interested Products and Proposed User Range are required

Currently, it causes issues to go back and forth between individuals because the reporter or prior assignee doesn't know that certain fields are required. 
Having this would improve cycle time, reduce frustration, and make the workflow appear smoother to our users.
fields.summary: Configure custom fields to be required based on the value of another custom field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42367].
  {panel}

Configure a custom field to only show based on the value of another custom field. 
For example, 

Custom field = Existing Client, Y/N
If Yes, show the custom fields: Client Name, Number of Licensed Users, Products Purchased
If No, do not show the fields.

Our issue screens are cluttered with many fields because we don't have this capability and it causes confusion to our users not knowing which ones to complete.
fields.summary: Ability to show a custom field based on another field's value
Ability to set inactive users automatically after certain time

fields.description:
I am trying to remove the "Browse Users" permission to make sure that some of our customers/suppliers, who must have access to the system, can't see names (and email addresses, which normally contain the company name) of other users. I have done so, but it works only partially:
* From the Issue Navigator I get no suggestions when I write "assignee = ", which is fine
* If I edit a custom field which is a User Picker I get no suggestions and the icon doesn't work, which is also fine
* If I try to Assign the issue, either from the Edit screen or using the Assign button directly, I do see everybody, including their email address.

This counts as a security bug for me, or at least as a "confidentiality" one. It means, for example, that I can't prevent my suppliers from seeing how many and which competitors they have. If for a given product we have only one supplier they might notice it, and they could raise their price or use this knowledge in some other way.
fields.summary: Removing "Browse Users" global permission doesn't work for the Assignee

fields.description: Under "Issue Links" I find the phrase "is dependant on".  This should be "is dependent on".
fields.summary: Misspelling: "is dependant on" should be "is dependent on"

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42362].
  {panel}

URLs in seraph-config.xml only applies to the Login button at the top right of the page. There are times where the login link can be found in a permission message. It would be great if we can change the URL of these links as well

h4. Steps
# Configure seraph-config.xml to redirect to your SSO login page
# Create a Board using a sample project (eg. Sample Scrum Project)
# Grant *Group (Anyone)* the *Browse Project* permission in the permission scheme
# For SSP Board, change the Filter Share such that anonymous users *cannot* view this filter
# As an anonymous user, try to manually enter the URL of the board (eg. http://localhost:8080/jira/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1)
# You will see the following message where the word *log in* is a hyperlink directing to http://localhost:8080/jira/login.jsp?os_destination=http%3A%2F%2F10.60.2.11%3A63131%2Fjira1%2Fsecure%2FRapidBoard.jspa%3FrapidView%3D1

{quote}The requested board cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it. This board may be visible if you log in.{quote}

!1.png!
fields.summary: SSO redirection for login link in permission messages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42361].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Recently, [this bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-28392] was fixed. However, it seems that this bug is still happening in some cases, where Japanese (or Chinese) characters are visible in some gadgets. 

This seems to be due to the fact that the fix to that bug had to be applied to all gadgets and possibly, not all gadgets were fixed.

This problem seems to be intermittent and the same gadgets that sometimes show the characters, sometimes are in English.

The text for the issue operation links shown per each activity stream item will sometimes be shown in a language different from the current user's locale.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(i)  In an instance that was affected by JRA-28392, if gadgets were not fixed, they may show in different languages.

# Change a user's (UserA) profile language to a language other than the configured default
# Restart JIRA
# Login as the UserA and visit a dashboard with the activity stream gadget
# Login as another user (UserB) that has no configured language
# Access a dashboard with the activity stream gadget as UserB
# The date and action links showed in German (UserA's configured language) while the rest of the screen was in English (the system default)

h3. Expected Results
The gadgets are in showing in the correct language.

h3. Actual Results
They may show in different languages, as JRA-28392 may still be affecting it.

h3.Workarounds
# Try the steps from the KB article [Setting locale in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/setting-locale-in-jira-314450433.html] to set Language = English and Country = US explicitly. (!) A restart of JIRA is required for it to take effect.
# Disable and re-enable JIRA Activity Stream Plugin, this can be found under Manage add-ons > Select System > Look for "JIRA Activity Stream Plugin", this helps for some of the customers.
fields.summary: Inconsistent languages displayed in Activity Stream gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42349].
  {panel}

The ability to select the option to have all other steps go to a selected step is really nice.  However, those transitions created don't appear in the list of transitions for a step when you want to remove it.  

Consequently, the value dimishes if you cannot remove it from a step since, in our case, there is usually only one transition that is valid from a closed state (reopen).  Thus, I had to go into the properties for that created transition and basically hide it from everyone.  

I have several scenarios where this would come in handy and make creating some very complex workflows less time consuming when the user wants to go from one transition to any transition (e.g. project implementations are like this).  

Right now, I've not given them this option because of the time required to setup all these transitions. We just say, move it to Hold and from hold you can go anywhere - so, that is our workaround. 

Please consider having this option as a great default to quickly apply transitions; but, allow an admin to remove them individually, where appropriate.
fields.summary: Ability to remove a transition that is generated from the designer

See http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-7.0-doc/changelog.html for details
Notably related to OFBIZ-5848 (Poodle) changes in Coyot
# support for TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 for APR connector. Based upon a patch by Marcel Šebek. This feature requires Tomcat Native library 1.1.32 or later. 
# Disable SSLv3 by default for JSSE based HTTPS connectors (BIO and NIO). The change also ensures that SSLv2 is disabled for these connectors although SSLv2 should already be disabled by default by the JRE. 
# Disable SSLv3 by default for the APR/native HTTPS connector.
fields.summary: Update embedded Tomcat to 7.0.58+

fields.description:
If the only link on an issue is a link to a Confluence page or some other external page there is no option to copy this link when cloning the issue.

*To Reproduce*
# Create an issue in JIRA.
# Link the issue to a Confluence page
# Clone the JIRA issue.

*Result*
In the Clone Issue dialog there is no checkbox to copy issue links.

*Expected*
The checkbox should be shown to copy issue links.

*Workaround*
# On the issue you want to clone, add a link to a different JIRA issue (just don't use 'clones' or 'is cloned by' types)
# Now when you clone there is a checkbox to copy links.  Check the box.  The Confluence/external link will be copied along with the JIRA issue link.
# After cloning, remove the unwanted JIRA issue link.
fields.summary: When cloning, issue links can not be copied unless there is a link to a JIRA issue
Allow drag and drop preference setting of workflow options

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42344].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

In JIRA 6 it is not possible anymore to add new notification types easily by just registering  a new notification type using NotificationTypeManager.setSchemeTypes().
Actually it's possible to register a new type but later when notification events are processed one gets exceptions as in https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/183097. So in my opinion NotificationTypeManager.setSchemeTypes() is broken and that is why i file this as a Bug.

We understand Atlassians efforts to keep the core stable against misbehaving getRecipients() methods in customer implemented NotificationType's. I am also aware that uninstalled customer plugins cause problems in the core when they leave configuration information but hey, why not just log this as a simple warning and ignore it?
Now we have to use NotificationFilter - which still can be implemented badly and thus is not adding stability - *and* we are not able anymore to store the notification scheme entries in column notify_type of table notification. This requires to create code (UI,backend) to persist this information elsewhere.

There really should be an easier way to allow the definition of custom notification types, e.g. by switching back to the JIRA 5 behaviour when a certain system property is set on startup. As a big enterprise customer I am aware of what my notification type code does. I see your best intentions but this makes our life difficult since we need either to spend money to create new solutions for something we already have *or* change system classes. Both is not acceptable for us!

In the final it's even not clear to me for which technical reason notification types have been hard coded in JIRA 6. As a consequence Atlassian should have deprecated NotificationTypeManager.setSchemeTypes() already in JIRA 5 because it is broken now in JIRA 6. Also notification-event-types.xml should have been removed in JIRA 6. The way it is now developers still have the impression the extension mechanism works. 

Regards,
Dieter
fields.summary: Custom notification types broken in JIRA 6

fields.description:
When users have a local group associated using a Read Only with Local Groups User Directory and change the directory permission to Read/Write or Read Only, the local group is lost when attempting to login to JIRA.
This can cause users to not be able to login after a User Directory change if the local group is required for login.
This did not happen in JIRA 6.0 and below.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Set a User Directory Read Only with Local Groups and synchronize it
# Add a local group to an LDAP user
# Change the User Directory permission to Read/Write or Read Only
# User still is a member of all the groups he was before
# Log in with the LDAP user

*Actual behaviour*
User loses his local groups after the login attempt

*Expected behaviour (Read only)*
User should lose his local groups after the User Directory permission is synchronized with the new permission
*Expected behaviour (Read/Write)*
Either the groups should be lost when the permission is synchronized with the new permission or the groups should remain after the login attempt and added to the LDAP server

If we try to remove the local group after changing the permission we get an error on screen.
{noformat}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42339].
  {panel}

Relates to JRA-5447

Problem description:
If an issue is Closed with Resolution Reject or Won't fix, and has Fix Version set, it will be included in the Release Note for the Fix Version.
The problem is that Resolution is not shown in the Release Notes, only Status, making harder for the user to see that it is wrong. Example scenario: It can lead that the customer is informed in the release defecte is corrected in the release, but in reality it is not since it is rejected.

Proposed fix:
Transition to Reject/Won't Fix, should then empty Fix Version in post-function.
fields.summary: Transition to Reject/Won't Fix should empty Fix Version in post-function

fields.description:
h2. Summary

The public atlassian maven repository ([https://maven.atlassian.com/public/]) does not provide javadoc jars for jira-api. We need this Javadoc as jar in the repo to efficiently code plugins.
h2. Expected results

The documentation states that there should be javadoc jars for all closed-source components (see below).
{quote}"The Atlassian public repository contains all artifacts necessary to build a plugin for our products. It contains binaries, source and javadoc of our opensource components, and binaries and javadoc for our closed-source components. Anyone can read from this repository. Only Atlassian staff can write to it."
{quote}
Excerpt from:
 [https://developer.atlassian.com/docs/advanced-topics/working-with-maven/atlassian-maven-repositories?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fdeveloper.atlassian.com%2Fdocs%2Fadvanced-topics%2Fworking-with-maven%2Fatlassian-maven-repositories&application=dac]
h2. Workaround

There is currently no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Maven repository does not provide javadoc jars for jira-api

fields.description:
I wrote a custom [JQL function|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-architecture/building-jira-add-ons/jira-plugins2-overview/jira-plugin-module-types/jql-function-plugin-module] plugin. While testing the plugin I found JqlFunction.getValues is called before JqlFunction.validate method, Due to this JqlFunction.getValues method executes 2 times. Here is the sequence of calls:

JqlFunction.getValues
JqlFunction.validate
JqlFunction.getValues (if there are no errors in validate method, it calls getValues again)

Ideally, JqlFunction.getValues should be called after JqlFunction.validate so that JQL logic execute once.
fields.summary: JQL function getValues method executes before validation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42328].
  {panel}

At the moment, if the users want to apply similar configuration on another instance, they need to do *Restore System*, which will not only restore the configuration, but also data (project, issues).

This would be useful to have a feature that allows customer to only migrate schemes to another instance.
- Workflow Scheme
- Permission scheme
- Notification scheme, etc

So in the case that the instances have different data, they can still apply the same schemes in both instances. For example, When the user wants to create a new project in another instance, the user could use the same schemes, instead of re-creating the new schemes and associated them with the projects, which will be time consuming.
fields.summary: Ability to only migrate JIRA schemes

!20150305174329001.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Individual Firefox users that are affected can increase the size of dom.storage.default_quota.  Details are available at [Accessing JIRA in the browser fails due to NS_ERROR_DOM_QUOTA_REACHED|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Accessing+JIRA+in+the+browser+fails+due+to+NS_ERROR_DOM_QUOTA_REACHED]
fields.summary: Exception: NS_ERROR_DOM_QUOTA_REACHED: Persistent storage maximum size reached

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42322].
  {panel}

We encountered situations, where the team was working towards finishing the next version / milestone. During that development phase, new issues (features / changes / bugs) were added to JIRA, but often the target version was forgotten to be defined for those issues.

It would be cool, if in the administrative view of a project, in the list of versions, one of the versions could be marked as "the default milestone" or similar - and after that, each new issue within this project automatically gets this version assigned as target version.

Still the user could manually remove this proposed target version - or replace it with a different milestone.

The use case would be, that there would basically be no issues anymore that are not assigned to a milestone (except it's manually chosen to be non targetet to a milestone).
fields.summary: Auto assign target version to new issues

fields.description:
h3. Steps

* Setup JIRA with an incoming create or comment email handler.
* Set up a user with an email address and change its profile so they are notified of their own changes.
* Login as that user.
* Create an issue that has one of the new priority icons in it.
* Check that user's inbox in Thunderbird/MS Outlook. 
* You should see a issue creation notification email and the new priority icon should be in it.
* Reply to this email so that a comment gets added to the JIRA issue.
* Check the JIRA issue in the browser.
* [BUG] A new comment will be added to the issue, and the priority icon will be added as an attachment to it.

h3. Root Cause

This is caused because this images were not checked into source tagged with the png metadata that is necessary for any email image sent from JIRA is meant for inclusion as an embedded image in email messages. 

Any image that is to be sent from JIRA in an email message needs to be tagged via PNG metadata so that the incoming mail handlers can identify them and not add them as attachments to the JIRA issue.

h3. Notes

From previous testing in this are we believe this will affect all email clients except outlook. All mail templates that include the priority icon in it will be affected (not only issue creation).

Replies to issue comment notifications are not affected given that the issue comment notification email does not show the Priority field.
fields.summary: New priority icons are being attached to JIRA issues upon replies to issue created notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42320].
  {panel}

At the moment, this page will display all of the fields that are associate with a particular project.

You can find the page as follows:
<instance>/secure/ShowConstantsHelp.jspa

It also may expose a critical internal information such as Issue Security Levels to the users that are not suppose to see it. Since security level are made to hide issues based on the user groupds, by showing the list of security levels in ShowConstantsHelp.jspa, may give internal information to the user. 

*The desired behaviour is to have a feature where user/administrator can hide or configure the content of ShowConstantsHelp.jspa*

h3. Workaround
Configure the create issues permission in your Permission Scheme to limit the number of users that can create an issue for particular project. 

If we have a project (let's called it Project A) that uses Issue Security Scheme A and Permission Scheme A, and has been set to only users in group A are able to create an issue for the project A, any users that are not belong to group A would not be able to create any issue for the project A. Hence, those users would not have the ability to search for the project during the issue creation screen, thus making the Issue Security levels for Issue Security Scheme A unavailable for them to see in ShowConstantsHelp.jspa as long as no project is using the same issue security scheme
fields.summary: Ability to hide or configure content of ShowConstantsHelp.jspa

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When importing Trello Boards into JIRA, if the Trello Board contains an '&' character in a list title this causes some problems with the import as per the attached exception in the logs. The import fails with an exception (attached to this issue).

However, some of the artefacts actually do get imported, causing the following error to appear every time you try to access the Admin Workflows page: ie: {{http://localhost:8080/jira/secure/admin/workflows/ListWorkflows.jspa}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install the Trello Importer for JIM
# Import a Trello Board with an "&" in the name of a list
# Observe the exception when importing the board
# Observe that you can no longer view workflows
# Observe the following exception in the logs when accessing the ListWorkflows page:
{code}
com.opensymphony.workflow.FactoryException: Error converting XML to workflow descriptor.: root cause: The entity name must immediately follow the '&' in the entity reference. (line:159 col:66)
{code}

h3. Expected Results
* A Failed import should not make changes to the JIRA environment

h3. Actual Results
* The import fails with an exception.

h3. Notes
* Screenshot of ListWorkflows after a failed import is attached.

h3. Workaround
The Environment can be fixed with the instructions listed [here| https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=646251124]

Remove the '&' character from the Trello Board and reattempt the import.
fields.summary: Importing Trello board does not validate content [Trello Importer Plugin]

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sometimes Issue Collectors are used for customers to collect feedback data for JIRA Issues. This may be a problem if the Location information that is collected is incorrect.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Issue Collector in any Project. Make sure the Checkbox for "Collect browser type, screen resolution, and the URL where the feedback was created" is checked.
# Take the <script> code and place it in the JIRA Administration > System > User Interface: Announcement Banner. You should see a "Provide Feedback" button in the UI.
# Go to the Issue Search Navigator. It doesn't matter if you are in a saved search filter or not.
# *Hit refresh on your browser.*
# Open an Issue. 
# Click the "Provide Feedback" button and create an Issue with the Issue Collector.
# Go to the new Issue that was created (by clicking on the link after submission, or going to the Issue in the Project).
h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

The Location information does not reflect the Issue or Search View that you were in when the "Provide Feedback" button was clicked. It only reflects the value from the last browser refresh. This is incorrect.

h3.Solution / Workaround

The following ticket may present a Workaround in some circumstances:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-40574

This ticket outlines a possible Workaround where the window.location information is collected at the form's display instead. This may not work if the Issue Collector is placed in the Announcement Banner for JIRA, as the environment is more restricted.
fields.summary: Issue Collector displays wrong Location information

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Superscript/subscript markup fails if not preceded by spaces

h3. Steps to reproduce 
 * Type in a comment/summary: 2 ^N^+1 and 2^N^+1 in wiki markup
 * Alternatively type ~0~+1 and a~0~+1 in wiki markup.

h3. Expected results
Correct markup with superscript (first case) and subscript (last case) is shown.
 
h3. Actual results
succeeds: 2 ^N^+1
fails: 2^N^+1

succeeds: a ~0~+1
fails: a~0~+1

h3. Workaround
* Use spaces between the object to be superscript/subscript
* You can put the markup in braces: {code}n{^}2^{code} results in: *n{^}2^*
** This workaround comes from [this community question|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/In-JIRA-wiki-markup-how-do-I-write-O-n/qaq-p/304956#M127550]. Credit to [~nomaed] for finding this.
fields.summary: Superscript/subscript markup fails if not preceded by spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42307].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA have been limiting "Bulk Edit" to only 1000 issues. While there might be a reason for the limitation such as it might able to impact the instance performance, there is no tool or other workaround to differentiate the previous edited 1000 issues if the issues that needs to be edited is more than 1000. While JIRA Admin able to make changes on the field to mark issues that have been edited, it will always be two steps operation:
# Bulk Edit and update fields to mark it while making the actually changes.
# Do another search with "!=" expression or JQL search that could differentiate it.
# Repeat.

These operation will take longer and major work to do if the issues need to be edited for example about 10,000, not to mention there could be a human error where the previous issues is included inside.

Hence, it would be great if there is a Tool or function that could segregated the 1000 issues out of 10,000 then runs automatically until those 10,000 issues is edited, rather than repeating the operation above again and again,
fields.summary: Automatically Edit 1000 Issues Continuously if Issues to be Edited is more than 1000

fields.description:
h4. Summary
According to [Creating a Notification Scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+Notification+Scheme] documentation, *Issue Moved* notification works as follow:
bq. An issue has been moved into or out of this project.
However, *Issue Moved* notification only received by the receiving (target) end, no notification on the source project

h4. Steps to Reproduce
To fully check whether the *Issue Moved* notification was sent properly:
# Clear *Issue Updated* notification
# Clear *Issue Assigned* notification
# Ensure that *User A* and *User B* has *Issue Moved* notification
# Move issue from *Project A* to *Project B*

h4. Expected Results
Both *User A* and *User B* receive the notification
{panel}
# If the functionality works as what it was described in the documentation, then *User A* will only need to have Notification Scheme added in *Project A* to get notification for issue moved into or out of the project
# If the notification was set up correctly, *User A* only need to be in the *Issue Moved* notification for *Project A* in order for it to receive notification for moved issue from that project to every other projects, and it doesn't need to be included on other project's notification scheme.
Basically it should work like: "_Hi user, issue from Project A has been moved to Project B_", "_Hi user, issue form Project A has been moved to Project C_"
{panel}

h4. Actual Results
Only the receiving end (*User B*, *Project B*) receive the notification.
In the Mail Queue there is only one mail in the queue, which indicates that only one user is receiving the notification

h4. Notes
Creating this bug not Improvement Request, because documentation says that _An issue has been moved into or out of this project._
fields.summary: No notification was sent for Issue Moved action

fields.description:
...and similarly for "Delete All Attachments"

It recently came to my attention that members of a Role with "Delete Own Attachments" permission cannot, in fact, delete their own attachments.

Perhaps I'm foolish for having taken the name and description of this permission at face value for all of these years. 

Explanatory text I've discovered that "Only users with administrative privileges to remove an issue can remove attachments," makes no sense to me. Why would the ability to remove an attachment be dependent on permission to delete issues?

I can understand why it might be desirable to prevent users who can delete issues from deleting arbitrary attachments (and this is likely the derivation of these permissions). But isn't it also equally reasonable that we might want to allow users to remove attachments without further allowing them to delete entire issues?

I fail to see a rationale why these two permissions should be linked at all, much less why the one should be dependent on the other.

Please decouple the Delete All/Own Attachments permissions from the Delete Issues permission.
fields.summary: "Delete Own Attachments" permission is not sufficient for a user to delete their own attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42282].
{panel}

h3. Summary
Executing requests to {{/jira/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?params}} on larger instances can take over a minute to complete and generate large content (500MB+). In some cases JIRA can run out of memory or have heavy GC pressure. At this stage we believe there are 2 possible problems:
# In case of standard requests with {{projects.issuetypes}} parameters, problem is caused by _duplicated data for issue-types_, see _Duplicate content_ below for details. 
# With {{fields}} added ({{createmeta?projects.issuetypes.fields}}), it's more likely that JIRA can run out of memory.  The main problem is that objects representing either issue types or custom fields are not reused among projects. So theoretically this issue could be reproduced with one multi-select custom field with thousands of values and a thousand of projects.

h3. Environment
The following data exists in the test instance:
{noformat}
Database Statistics
Issues          417547
Projects        1481
Custom Fields   1203
Workflows       324
Attachments     0
Comments        2921131
Users           17225
Groups          985
{noformat}

And 323 issue types.
h5. For {{projects.issuetypes.fields}} paraments
Having instance with multi-select CF with large number of values magnifies the problem. 
So problem is a multiplication of factors:
*  Number of _CustomFields values_ x Number of _IssueTypes_ x Number of _Projects having that_

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup or use an instance with similar data sizes.
 # Query {{/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?projects.issuetypes}}, for example [https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?projects.issuetypes].

h3. Expected Results
The query returns in a reasonable timeframe. No JVM memory pressure.

h3. Actual Results
The query takes ~60 secs as per the attached screenshot, or in some cases runs out of memory entirely.

h3. Possible cause and room for improvement
We decided to remove this endpoint in Jira 9.0 see [Createmeta REST endpoint to be removed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjira/createmeta-rest-endpoint-to-be-removed-975014604.html]

h4. Duplicate content
We have seen that in some cases there are _logical duplicates_ in the {{optionconfiguration}} table. This, depending on the number of affected issue types, can cause performance issues itself. To check for such, you can run the following query:
{code:java}
// Check duplicated issuetype, query should return 0
select optionid,fieldconfig,count(1) from optionconfiguration where fieldid = 'issuetype' group by optionid,fieldconfig having count (1) > 1;

// Check all duplicated options, query should return 0
SELECT fieldid,optionid,fieldconfig, count(*) FROM optionconfiguration group by fieldid,optionid,fieldconfig having count(*)>1
{code}
If the above returns any rows, you are likely affected by the problem. In this case, please raise a ticket on [https://support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/], referring to this bug report and ask for assistance on de-duplicating the table.
See related JRASERVER-66306 

h3. Workarounds
* Block the call to REST API at proxy level
** Any integration using this API will be affected, (eg: create JIRA issue from Confluence will not work)
* Increasing the heap could be strategy for small heaps (< 10GB)

h5. Specific workarounds for {{projects.issuetypes.fields}}
REST _createmeta_ will show all data to create issue, so you remove the CF from screen it will be not present in the payload for that specific issues.
* If possible, delete unused CustomFields and/or CustomFields values. 
** Make CustomFields more specific:
*** Choose applicable issue types
*** Choose applicable context (Project)
** Remove the CustomFields from screen which are not require it.
fields.summary: On large instances the createmeta REST endpoint can take a very long amount of time to return results or cause JIRA to OOM
